item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Dangerous junction for cyclists, 24th July
item.description:
Dangerous junction for cyclists go up Dulwich Wood Park / College Road A2199 cycle track and cycle lane and then turning RIGHT into Crystal Palace Parade. Drivers regularly seen to encroach the cycle ASL box designed for cycles. And cycles regularly stop in advance of this box as this arm of the junction is on a steep hill and many cyclists prefer to wait (or red aspect) much near the signals on a less steep part of the road. Ideally having cycle early release would be ideal. Please consider making the cycle ASL area near the traffic signals at the top of the hill.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic light for road work but no work has been done, 24th July
item.description:
Barriers went up almost 2 weeks ago on this main road. Temporary traffic light has also been set up since but no work has even started yet! This is causing so much delays for residents and making the road crossing unsafe as cars are trying to speed past the temporary traffic lights. Numerous reports have been sent and nothing has been done about this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Crofton Lane, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights
